answers.answer: There are 2 things that come to mind right off the bat -- first off, have you been checked for type I (juvenile) diabetes?  That can cause weight loss and inability to gain.The second thing is hyperthyroidism.  If your thyroid is over active, your metabolism will be speeded up to the point where everything you eat is used up very quickly, so there will be nothing for reserves.Both of these conditions can be very serious, but both are also easily confirmed/ruled out, with some simple blood tests.  So I strongly recommend that you get tested.  To test for diabetes, you will need fasting blood sugar, a hemoglobin A1c and probably a glucose tolerance test (that takes the longest).   To test for hyperthyroidism, you will need a TSH, Free T3 and Free T4 to begin with.
